column1: While writing Spring projects we often need to specify some configurations in the application.properties (or .yml) file. What is the name of the folder that contains this file?
What is the name of Spring Boot config file?
What naming pattern do all the Spring Boot starters follow?
Why were Spring Boot starters created?
column2: to bring new technologies to the Spring framework
column3: to simplify dependency management and speed up the development process
column4: to simplify dependency management and make programs run faster
column5: to decrease the number of bugs and make programs run faster

column1: We started a new Spring project. What will happen if we remove the @SpringBootApplication annotation located above the main class and try to run the program?
column2: The program will start but some Spring features will not be enabled
column3: We will see an error and the program won't start
column4: This annotation is used to annotate methods, not classes
column5: Nothing will happen, this annotation can be skipped and the program will work correctly
